info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 24 at 6:35PM EDT until September 24 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Charleston WV
info.description:
At 635 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated gauges indicated heavy rain showers across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. The heaviest of the rain was over, with additional rainfall amounts of less than 0.5 inches expected in the warned area this evening. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Emergency management reported flooding of roadways along Adams and Fifth Avenue, including the 1st Street Viaduct and at 25th Street. Some lanes had reopened.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain showers.
SOURCE...Radar.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Huntington, Chesapeake, Barboursville and Pea Ridge.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of streets around Huntington. The highest threat areas for flooding are the railroad viaducts at 1st, 8th, 10th, 16th and 20th streets. In addition, the railroad viaduct at 14th street west may flood. Flooding may also be occurring along 5th avenue between 24th and 25th streets.
Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR WEST CENTRAL CABELL COUNTY
